page.title: 01GREENIGO GRIFFYELT SCAPA BAY
page.content: Two thirds of this area is sea, Scapa flow. The Wreck of Roal Oak sunk during World War 2, rests in the south east corner. Oil still leaks from the wreck now a war grave, a wreath is placed over the wreck each year. The A964 runs through the north west corner of this square it is lined with dwelling houses and small farms, mainly arable.Approximately two thirds of the land in this square is rough heather and hill ground. Among the other buildings is a breakdown and general repair garage, a disused school, now used occasionally as a sunday school, and among the modern housing development at Foveran, is a guest house and restaurant (as mentioned in the Good Food Guide). This part of Scapa Flow is used as a safe anchorage for oil & gas tankers waiting to be loaded at the Oil Term.
